intro: Hoya irisiae, commonly known as the "Iris Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its waxy, thick leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces pale pink to white blooms that are often fragrant, and it is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya irisiae is popular among indoor gardeners due to its ease of care and ornamental value.
